questions.question2: ways to write comments in JavaScript :
questions.answer: Using // , a multi-line comment beginning with /* and ending with */

questions.answer: CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheet.

questions.question2: What is the use of CSS Opacity?
questions.answer: The CSS opacity property is used to specify the transparency of an element. In simple word, you can say that it specifies the clarity of the image
The universal selector matches the name of any of the element type instead of selecting elements of a specific type.

questions.question1: Name the property for controlling the image scroll in the background.
questions.answer: The background-attachment property is used to specify if the background image is fixed or scroll with the rest of the page in the browser window. If you set fixed the background image, then the image not move during scrolling in the browser

questions.question2: What is the difference between class selectors and id selectors?
questions.answer: An overall block is given to class selector while id selectors take only a single element differing from other elements.
RWD stands for Responsive Web Design
HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language
HTML tags are composed of three things: an opening tag, content and ending tag. Some tags are unclosed tags.

questions.question3: How to insert a copyright symbol on a browser page?
questions.answer: You can insert a copyright symbol by using © or © in an HTML file

questions.question1: How do you keep list elements straight in an HTML file?
questions.answer: You can keep the list elements straight by using indents.
HTML layout specifies a way in which the web page is arranged.
